[3]
answer: (higher temperature means) particles collide (with rubber) harder / with more force / with greater momentum (change) B1 (larger volume means) particles collide (with rubber) less frequently OR (larger volume means) larger (surface) area (for particle collisions)   B1 effect of larger volume cancels effect of increased temperature / owtte OR the effect of larger area cancels the effect of larger force / owtte OR P = F / A so the two changes cancel each other / owtte B1

The student draws line EN as shown in Fig. 3.1. On Fig. 3.1, measure the angle θ1 between the lines LN and EN.  θ1 = ..................................................... [1]

A student investigates the refraction of light by a transparent block. He uses his results to determine a quantity known as the refractive index of the material of the block. The student's ray-trace sheet is shown full size in Fig. 3.1.  (DIAGRAM)   The student places two pins, P1 and P2, on line EN, as shown in Fig. 3.1. Suggest whether the two pins are a suitable distance apart for accurate ray tracing. Explain your answer. statement .................................................................................................................................. explanation ............................................................................................................................... ................................................................................................................................................... [1]
answer: not suitable  should be as far apart as possible  1

question: A student investigates the refraction of light by a transparent block. He uses his results to determine a quantity known as the refractive index of the material of the block. [1]
